intro: Erysimum australe, commonly known as the Australian wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Erysimum australe is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
